it's time for a review of the new Daniel

everything from that era feels like it

placements from the likes of Pharrell
John Mayer and Brandy and at least show
that he was willing to experiment a bit
in order to break away away from the
kind of homogeneous and predictable
sounds of his debut that's kind of the
issue while I have been listening to

know the general musical world he
operates in I'm still not entirely sure
what sets him apart from many of his
comparable contemporaries for sure I
know he has a poet's pen and a

Always doesn't sound like an attempt to

however at this point in his career I
